name: Uma Sapna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out of our 10 day honeymoon trip to Bali and Dubai, the first 3 nights were at Uma Sapna. Uma Sapna in Seminyak area was chosen as the preferred stay option entirely based on reviews on Tripadvisor. Our wonderful stay at Uma Sapna has set the benchmark for every other hotel stay of ours.
reviews.title: Super Bliss...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Going point by point:
reviews.title: Great Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - within short distance of shopping streets, restaurants and pubs (though Kuta was more crowded, Seminyak was more homely);
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concept of hotel - Private Villas with private swimming pools and warm hospitality - wat else one wants on their honeymoon :)
reviews.title: Nice villa but the service was lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Villas - Beautiful, well maintained, elegance in every aspect - a perfect setting for honeymooners
reviews.title: Suit for Family Vacation

likes.liked: — value villa with a great service
likes.disliked: — the location and lack of views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Visited Bali from May 23-31 and was planned to stay here for 4 nights followed by another 4 nights stay at another Villa. As this was my first family visit to Bali which also included my parents aged 70+, I was extra conscious about the accommodation class and standards meeting my parents' expectations.
reviews.title: Nothing more Pristine than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: After a very quick check-in, we were in our 2Bedroom Villa - PAPUA. When we were inside, everything was beyond imagination. A fairly adequately sized private swimming pool with a statue of Lord Ganesha at the opposite end, a spacious open type Living and Dining area and then the 2 Bedrooms (mirror images of each other) side by side. The most novel designing idea I felt was the bathroom location which was at the back of the Bed with entry from both sides of the bed. Individually enclosed cubicles for Toilet/WC and for shower and a large bath tub, all made of Italian marble (there were patches on the marble though, which indicated that they need to be re-polished or changed).
reviews.title: Super place.. im still in awe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was heavenly, with a wide choice - local indonesian specialities like Nasi Goreng (rice), Mie Goreng (noodles) all cooked vegetarian. Other than this, the ABF was always another option but never felt like going for it. We did complain about the portion in some cases such as cereals and breads etc being less but I realized lately that we were supposed to submit separate breakfast forms Bedroom-wise whereas I filled in only 1 form thinking it was for one villa.
reviews.title: Perfect - never wanted to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt my decision of staying at Uma Sapna was spot-on when my mother asked me on the day of check-out as to why we are shifting to other villa when our stay at Uma Sapna was so pleasant!
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On one of the instances I was cheated by a Money Changer, which I realized only after getting back to the villa that 6 notes out of 18 were short despite having counted and checked at the spot. I casually asked Mr. Putu and his colleague at front desk as to how the money changers cheat? They immediately sensed that I was cheated. The most delightful part of this episode was that they asked their security officer to go with me to the money changer and assured me that I would get my money back and that is what actually happened. I simply told the money changer that he cheated me and to my surprised the money changer immediately removed exactly 6 notes of IDR 50,000 each from his pocket and gave them to me without even a word of argument. I learnt never to try out any money changer and simply stuck to the one they recommended.
reviews.title: excellent! great value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Bali... after doing some research with friends decided to stay in Seminyak and then resorted to tripadvisor to find the appropriate place... we chose Uma Sapna based on the location, price range and reviews… beware that the beach is not close to Uma Sapna and the beach in Seminyak is not nice at all, therefore go to Uma Sapna for the Villas, for the service or location, not for the beach…
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic... lived to expectations... loved Uma Sapna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Suffice to say that the experience overall was fantastic… we were staying at Gili Villa, one bedroom with plunge pool at 120 usd per night per couple… the villa was beautifully decorated and the gardens and pool were stunning! I am very picky regarding bed, sheets and pillows and this was one of the best mattresses ever! There is a shower and a bathtub and a loungeing area as well inside, plus a day bed and dining area in the terrace… downside of the room is that there is no door between bed and bathroom so no privacy, which for us was not an issue… also there is some light coming from bathroom area in the morning but it did not bother us at all… The room is very private and you only hear the sound from the water falling from your pool and the birds, really quiet and relaxing…
reviews.title: Total gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was spotless at all times and they accommodated all our requests within minutes, really responsive in all manners… we rented a car (SUV) and the car was in perfect conditions as well…
reviews.title: Absolutely excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The master pool is fantastic and the whole complex has a luxurious and secluded feel… Uma Sapna is walking distance to the main street with coffees, restaurants and shops, which is quite convenient… We tried Trattoria and Chandi in the main strip and I cannot stress enough how good Chandi is, if you have opportunity go there for dinner, amazing experience!
reviews.title: Our Little Heaven..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried as well the spa and liked it a lot, good professional service and super good prices.. the breakfast was more like a feast and plenty of options to choose from…
reviews.title: Good value in an increasingly expensive location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there with a friend of ours. We spent the first two nights in two separate villas across from each other, and just loved both of them. Then we moved to one of the two bed room villas in the original part of the resort - very relaxing interior design.
reviews.title: You just cannot leave your villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was always very attentive and helpful.
reviews.title: Loved my stay !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time for our friend to visit Bali, and we asked her repeatedly if she would like to visit other parts of the island. The answer we got was no - it was just too comfortable to leave our Villa.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to bali for my honeymoon. Chose to stay at uma sapna after reading positive reviews. We got a one bedroom villa w/ its own small pool ( you can only take a dip not big enuf to swim ). A bock of four villas had a common swimming pool as well. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms were very roomy / clean. Staff was very helpful. There might have some difficulty communicating w/ them owing to English not being their first language. But it wasnt one bit frustrating. Staff was always smiling and willing to accomodate. I wasnt expecting a pickup at the airport and was thrilled when my wife pointed to guy holding a board w/ my name on it while I was looking for the "exit" directions :). Location wise might not be the best but I loved the proximity to Kuta beach and "ku de ta". There were some decent eateries close by as well. Breakfast was decent. Intial couple of days I was eating continental and quickly switched to Indonesian breakfast :). The sweet memories from the trip and the fragrance of the frangipani linger on ..............
reviews.title: Great by all means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were having a hard time to pick a villa in Bali and a friend of mine recommended this villa to us. Location was in Seminyak Area, an upscale district filled with trendy restaurants and bars, art shops and spas.
reviews.title: Truly the Way you like it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had spent the first part of our trip in Sanur - so decided to do a "villa" vacation to end it off. Our stay in Uma Sapna was excellent. Service was so good - even better than some of the 5-star/ 6-star hotels we have been in. Rooms were clean, food was delicious and the pool was very well-maintained. Even though we had the room that was closest to the main road, we still felt that we had our privacy.
reviews.title: A real gem - fantastic, luxurious and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of our toddler, we had quite a few requests, and the hotel staff was quick to respond and was always friendly, patient and extremely courteous. We loved every minute of our stay at this hotel. Everyone said HI (even the gardeners!) and the place was beautiful. We wil definitely be returning!
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from Bali after a 4-night stay at Uma Sapna. The pick up was there when we arrived. We booked into the executive villa with private pool. We were greeted by friendly staff at the villa and were served a mixed fruit juice. The room itself was of a good size with flat screen tv, DVD player, free wi-fi, a good selection of toiletries (shower gel, shampoo and conditioner came in ceramic jars) with large stoned bath and separate shower area (which can fit a whole family of 4 comfortably if that appeals to anyone), a two-seater sofa with two rattan stools. The pool was also adequate in size, just nice for a relaxing dip (but forget about doing laps). The lounge area is located outside by the pool which has a fridge, tea-/coffee-making amenities, lounge chair for suntanning and seating and table for breakfast which was served on time every time and well-prepared (try the eggs benedict). Generally each villa is very private even if your neighbours are around.
reviews.title: Never regret....
Great Service, Good Value for money
reviews.text: The villa is a about a 5-10min (between 200m-1km) walk to trendy restaurants and shops along a street that leads to the beach and a good 20-30min (1.5km) to the beach itself. It is also about a 3-5min walk to another shopping area (via an alley) full of quaint shops, spas, good eating establishments. So the location of the villa, while not at the doorstep of the shopping/restaurant belt, is within a stone's throw, which is ideal if you want a quiet getaway without being isolated from the action.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus points: Extensive breakfast menu selection, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff (everyone whom I came across greeted me with sincere smiles), sizeable straw-weave bag for trips to the deli or yoga.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is lovely, breakfast was served in our room on time every morning, there were a few mistakes with what we asked for but we didnt mind as they brought loads to eat. The rooms are clean and simply decorated with white walls and bold prints on the wall. The large double raindrop shower was awesome and the large bathtub comfortably fitted myself and my husband... perfect!! The swimming was nice and big, i would definitely recommend going for the larger executive pool villa... perfect for midnight swims with a few bottles of Bintang beers. The only negative is the 20min walk to the beach and 10 minute walt to eat street, but you dont have to walk a cab costs 50pence or 7000 rupiah. If you prefer laying by a pool, id definitely say opt for a pool villa, not worth paying to be on the beach when the big hotels on the beach dont actually have sunbeds on the beach themselves. The sea in seminyak is quite wavy and rough anyways.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel, peaceful, quiet, tastefully decorated, lovely large private pool! Definitely stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: It was my fourth stay at Uma Sapna and my eleventh trip to Bali. Lia and her staff were fantastic as usual. I stayed in the "Timor" villa. The trip was a mix of business and pleasure and they catered for both. I have stayed a similar property types, but after staying here I will look no further.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has it all.
reviews.title: Amazing Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villas are beautifully appointed with everything that could add to your experience catered for. They are also very generous in size, many with pools bigger than entire studios in Sydney!
reviews.title: Loved every minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems a shame to point out one part of Uma Sapna as it is all so good. Pack some high expectations and let Uma Sapna and its wonderful staff exceed all of them.
reviews.title: Perfect, thank you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am almost hesitant to add another positive review for this property as, up until now, it seems to be some what of a well kept secret!! Our stay at Uma Sapna was pleasant from beginning to end. A friendly driver collects you from the airport (inside the terminal with a welcome sign) and once you get in the car you are handed a cold refreshing towel followed by friendly conversation on the way to the hotel. All staff we meet spoke good english and would do anything they could to help you. Our villa was clean, private and very spacious!! The courtyards for the villa was huge and well kept. Breakfast in the outdoor dining area was enjoyable and relaxing on the day bed and in the private pool was heaven! The spa is well appointed with friendly staff and is extremely well priced and the menu has a lot of inticing treatments to choose from. Reception staff are friendly, helpful and honest - telling us to change money out of the hotel to get a better rate. They also arranged transportation to and from Ubud with a wonderful driver and at a great price. The location suited us with shops and restaurants close by. The beach is not that far but those that are after a beach holiday may find it a little isolated. We had room service one night and although the service was good we found the means a little small in comparison to the cost. No real complaints to list about Uma Sapna, a great place to stay that we will surely return to when next in Bali!!!
reviews.title: Quiet Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Uma Sapna expecting good things from the reviews and the website, but the experience that awaited us was so much better than we had dared to hope for. We had a polite and professional driver collect us from the chaos of Denpasar airport, and when we arrived at reception we were informed that we had been upgraded from a 1 bedroom villa with private pool to a 1 bedroom executive villa. The grounds are meticulously kept, the villa spacious and private. The bathroom was just incredible with an enormous bath and a shower that took up a small room! We found the service to be great, with reception happy to bring you anything you need. The spa menu and room service menu were very reasonably priced and we enjoyed both. We had no complaints at all - in fact we're worried that we will never enjoy another holiday as much! (until we come back, that is)
reviews.title: Cannot recommend it more highly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Uma Sapna for my wedding anniversary. We just had the most wonderful time.
reviews.title: Most Enjoyable Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in their one bedroom villa with your own private pool. It is actually one of the best villa we stayed so far for the price we pay and the facilities they have in the room.
reviews.title: a great modern experience in a traditional landscape.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended for couples who is seeking some privacy but enjoy the convenience and services of a hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a private getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I travelled to Bali with our 2 & a half year old daughter for a friends wedding. We stayed at Uma Sapna for 12 nights and absolutely loved it.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great Value, Loved the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a two bedroom villa with pool, I was a little worried about having a pool with my young daughter around so had asked Uma Sapna before booking if they had a pool fence available. They said they would arrange something for us, when we arrived we found that it appeared that they had constructed a timber fence around the pool for us which I consider was excellent service.
reviews.title: Everything and more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were exceptionally friendly, especially when we had our daughter, they would come out from everywhere when we walked past just to say 'hi'.
reviews.title: Always good to return to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service breakfast wasn't anything to rave about, but it was still quite reasonable. For the last 4 or 5 days we travelled down to Ku De Ta for breakfast and usually stayed there on the day beds until lunch time. Our daughter would play on the grass or in the kiddy pool there.
reviews.title: No Regrets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was excellent as it was a short stroll (say 200m) up the road to "Eat Street" Jl Laksmana/Oberoi or through a laneway to the main shopping street Jl Raya Seminyak. Because the place is tucked away a little it feels very quiet and with our own pool we felt like we were the only people there.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected.

description: Experience privacy and luxury, "just the way you like it" at the Uma Sapna, a private villa complex inspired by contemporary design, is a reflection of Bali's creative essence. The resort is situated in a residential environment in the heart of Bali's upscale Seminyak village. Featuring 24 one bedroom and 2 two bedrooms villas, scattered over the property, each protected for privacy. Shopping and international dining are within five minutes walking distance. Uma Sapna boasts all the expected comforts and services you will find in a five-star resort. Private dining can be enjoyed in your own villa. The Uma Sapna Spa offers a luxurious full-service massage and body therapy in any of our three spa treatment rooms or in the privacy of your villa.
